segments.text: Yeah. So, uh we are now learning that
the death toll has risen to 203 in uh in
Iran. And one of the most remarkable
things about this is watching these
images that are uh we're seeing out of
Iran. Um the government of course has
cut off the internet to the entire
country. Uh they've even uh cut off
landlines like old timey phone lines uh
because they're trying to keep these
images from getting out. uh they've been
cutting electricity to cities and uh
instepped Elon Musk with Starlink. The
reason that we're seeing these images
right now is because uh Starlink using
satellites over Iran is able to and it's
not a perfect system. It's not uh not
everybody has the access that they that
they want or that they need, but enough
of these images and and video is getting
out, which is the only reason we're
seeing this. And one of the things I
think is so interesting about this is
that and and a real question is the the
amount the number of uh outlets
mainstream media outlets who are
ignoring this story for some reason. For
some reason they don't uh realize that
this is the biggest story probably in
the Middle East in uh in in nearly 50
years.
>> Yeah. I mean, make no mistake, these
images make a difference because public
opinion uh globally makes a difference.
I still remember um I don't know, it was
four years ago when the Cubans had an
uprising and it was quite significant.
And what they wanted was video images to
go out to the world, not just of the
protests um but also of the repression
um when the government finally got
control and started to um arrest uh and
and and and beat down many of the
protesters and they were begging Joe
Biden for the ability um you know to
send some help for satellite so they
could get those images out and Joe Biden
said no. But then when the same things
happened uh two years ago in Venezuela,
Elon Musk, they didn't have to beg Joe
Biden for anything. They were able to
get it from Elon Musk just as the
Iranians are doing. So Elon Musk, you
know, just as he freed Twitter, um
really playing a giant role in um in in
in getting allowing people to to to
speak freely and also for all of us to
see what's going on. And you know to
that point Rachel you got me thinking
he's also like we saw President Trump
saying we've got your back to Iran. Elon
Musk is also standing with them. Just
two days ago Elon Musk responded to
Ayatollah Ket has been ratt saber
rattling and saying we won't be
defeated. And Musk tweeted a very famous
Persian uh saying which is essentially
say that the I told said we won't be
defeated and he he tweeted out in Farsy
he tweeted out that uh you know the the
phrase that means wishful thinking or a
vain fantasy that you won't be defeated
and these protesters have been chanting
that phrase in these protest last point
it is so amazing because Lucas talked
about pre979 Iran so many anyone under
40 years old is fighting for freedom
that they have never in their life.
>> That's such a great point. Well, you saw
that uh that tweet out from Lindsey
Graham. A lot of people get nervous when
they see Lindsey Graham promoting
something um some kind of military
foreign action. Um but it's going to be
interesting because we're going to have
Patrick Bet David. He is a refugee from

know, podcaster um and businessman in
America here. and we're going to have

going on, what he thinks will happen,
and what the implications for the Middle
East will be, and whether he thinks
President Trump should assist these
protesters. So, this is a very
interesting um story and segment. Stay
